fields.description:
h2. Summary

The up-coming events badge feature of Team Calenders added since version 5.3.10 is causing excessive calls to the REST resource /calendar/events/upcoming. We've seen this cause 50% of database load on a large installation of Confluence.

h2. Steps to Reproduce

# Install Team Calendars 5.3.10 on a high volume Confluence server
# Monitor using New Relic or similar tooling
# Observe the database is hitting the cwd_membership table many times due to the transactions involving /calendar/events/upcoming

h2. Expected Results

Minimal impact to database load due to this feature.

h2. Actual Results

Database usage pattern shows a large amount attributed to this feature's REST call, around 50% of all usage.
 
h2. Workaround 1
Upgrade to Team Calendars 5.3.11 or higher. This version introduces some mitigation to the performance impact of badges in that if there are more than five calendars in a given space, then the badges will be disabled for that space in the sidebar.

However, if this is not enough, you can disable badges entirely (only available in 5.3.11 or higher) by access the following URL as a Confluence administrator :
{{http://<confluence_url>/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/events/upcoming/false}}
This will set a flag in the database to disable badges in the side bar menu. To re-enable, access the same URL but change "false" to "true".

To check if this if and how this is set in the database, use this query and observe the {{bandanavalue}} column (true=enabled / 
false=disabled). Also, if no rows are returned, it means badges are enabled as per default:
{code}
SELECT * FROM BANDANA WHERE bandanakey = 'com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.admin.space.showUpcommingEventBadge';
{code}

h2. Workaround 2
If you are not able to upgrade to Team Calendars 5.3.11+ and use the first workaround, you can disable the "Team Calendar On Space Sidebar Link(space-calendar-sidebar-link)" module of the Team Calendars plugin to completely disable the "Calendars" menu item in the side link entirely.

h2. Workaround 3
If Confluence is behind a load balancer or reverse proxy, block the URL /calendar/events/upcoming there, so that it never reaches Confluence and thus does not cause database load.

h2. Note
Due to the performance impact, this feature has been _removed_ since Team Calendar 5.3.12 thus the release that is downloadable in [Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/72307/team-calendars-for-confluence/version-history] will not include this feature from Team Calendar 5.3.16 onwards (up to v6.0.17 as of the date of this bug report being updated). 
(i) This applies to Team Calendar for *Confluence Server* as well.
fields.summary: Up-coming events badge causes high database load due to REST resource being hit excessively

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating a new page in Confluence that is based on a template that includes a variable list object, the created page only renders the first item within the list.

h3. Environment
Cloud - 1000.230.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new template
# Add a list variable to the template with multiple items
# Save the template
# Create a page based on the template you created

h3. Expected Results
The page should be created and all of the list items should be present in the list

h3. Actual Results
Only the first item defined in the list is present
 
h3. Notes
Editing the page will result in you only being able to see the first item you had in your list. 
Viewing the template, will result in your seeing your list

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround currently
fields.summary: Only the first list item is rendered when creating a page based on a template that includes a list variable

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/28+June+2015+to+4+July+2015

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When set up a background color from *Table Cell (td)* inside a cell within a table. One cell is created automatically.

h3. Environment

Confluence version - 1000.177.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new Confluence page
# Insert a table with at least two cells
# Add the macro *Table Cell (td)* inside on cell
# Set a background color like: #A750A5
# Click on Preview or Save
# On cell will be created automatically.

h3. Expected Results
The color should fill the cell where belongs.

h3. Actual Results
One additional cell is created.
 
h3. Notes
I could reproduce it on Chrome and Firefox.

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround so far.
fields.summary: When set up a background color from *Table Cell (td)*, a cell is created automatically

Issue with images being cut off in iOS9 in Safari on iPad. Issue occurs on 2 column format.

h3. Environment
* Confluence mobile desktop version 5.9.1-OD-2015.44.1-0002
* iPad using iOS9.0 with Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log into Confluence
# Create a page with images and 2 columns
# Images will be cut off. Text will wrap correctly.

h3. Expected Results
For images to resize correctly when looking using Confluence Mobile. 

h3. Actual Results

{noformat}
When accessing Confluence Mobile Desktop version: 5.9.1-OD-2015.44.1-0002 on a mini iPad using iOS9.0 with Safari causes the images embedded in the 2 column format to be cut off. See attached screenshot.
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
The text seems to wrap correctly though. This issue was discovered when user tried to use Confluence Mobile after the fix related to CONF-39310

h3.Workaround
No workaround found at this time.

h3. Environment
Chrome (45.0.2454.101): 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Created page with a table layout with empty row and a row with info macro
# Save the page
# Edit the page and edit the table layout
# Hit backspace

h3. Expected Results
It should not remove empty row from the table. 

h3. Actual Results

!row.png|thumbnail!

Hitting the backspace with a cell of the table works fine with other browsers 

h3.Workaround
Use other browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the text you're trying to highlight is also present inside an Office Macro on the same page, the Inline comment will fail to be added.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Word or Excel document with the text {{uniquestring}} on it
# Create a Confluence page with the text {{uniquestring}} on it
# Attach the File from step one and embed it on the page using the Office Excel or Word macro.
# Highlight your text from step 2 and try to add an inline comment

h3. Expected Results
The comment is added normally

h3. Actual Results
No comment is added and the user is shown the following warning:
{noformat}
We can't add your inline comment; the section you highlighted may contain a macro or user mention. Try highlighting plain text.
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Change the text in either the Confluence page or inside the embedded document so that both are unique. This bug is Case Sensitive so changing capitalisation will be enough.
fields.summary: Inline comments don't work for pieces of text that are duplicated inside an office Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Issues macros that are embedded inside Page Properties macros don't load any details when they're rolled up into the corresponding Page Properties Report macro.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud (6.0.0-OD-2016.02.2 and 2016-03.01)
* JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start with a JIRA + Confluence Cloud instance.
# In Confluence, create a page with a Page Properties Report macro on it.
# Create another page with the Page Properties macro in it that'll show in the Page Properties Report macro above.
# Insert a table into the Page Properties macro that contains a JIRA Issues Macro that will return some number of issues from JIRA.
# View the original page with the Page Properties Report on it.

h3. Expected Results
The JIRA Issues Macro that's in the Page Properties macro shows the details of the JIRA issues it's found within the Page Properties Report macro.

h3. Actual Results
The JIRA Issues macro just sits there spinning, saying "Getting issues" and never goes further.
 
h3. Notes
There's no Javascript errors in the browser console, there's no errors in the JIRA or Confluence logs, and no spike in CPU usage in JIRA or Confluence. It occurs regardless of browser. The JIRA Issues macro loads fine within the page that the Page Properties macro is on, just not the Page Properties Report macro.

h3.Workaround
None as yet.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue macros inside Page Properties Report macro don't load, spin forever instead

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a space with one user ("Alice", say), create a second user ("Bob") who has permission to edit pages in that space.
# Create a page in the new space, add page restrictions so only Alice can edit it (everyone else can view it though).
# Log in as Bob, bring up the Page Restrictions dialog on the newly-created page.

h3. Expected Results
The Page Restrictions dialog shows _only_ Alice as having edit permission and everyone else has view-only permission.

h3. Actual results
The Page Restrictions dialog confusingly shows Bob as having Edit permission despite there being no "Edit" button on the page.
fields.summary: Page Restrictions dialog mistakenly shows current user as having edit permission if they have space edit permission but not page

h2. Problem Description

When clicking on the refresh button on Application Navigator, the loading wheel keeps spinning. See below:

 !Screen Shot 2016-08-02 at 8.10.12 PM.png|thumbnail!

The list of Application Navigator was refreshed and return the appropriate values.

h2. Actual Behavior

h3. Summary
In Collaborative Editing, when users re-edit a page that contains expand macros in panel macro, right after they have discarded the changes on that page, extra line breaks automatically appear between the panel or inside the panel.

h3. Environment
* Confluence version 1000.242.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Turn on Collaborative Editing
# Create a page with panel macros and expand macros
# Edit the page
# Discard the changes
# Re-edit the page

h3. Screencast on how to replicate the bug
http://www.screencast.com/t/mNN1DbFl4Sm

h3. Expected Results
No extra line break when editing the page.

h3. Actual Results
Extra line break automatically added in the panel macro.

h3. Workaround.
Remove the extra line

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence is not picking up System Timezone changes in Cloud instances.
There is a specific task that overwrites system changes to the default timezone that the instance was created at.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change System Timezone of a Cloud instance
# Verify if changes are applied on the "System Information" section: "System Timezone"

*Expected Results:* JDK timezone, based on system timezone is used
*Actual Results:* Previous Timezone is still configured
 
h3.Workaround
Manually set the Timezone in the database (Contact Cloud Support)
fields.summary: System Timezone change is not picked up in Cloud

fields.description:
As described in [these release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+5.7+Release+Notes], Confluence is now handling attachments differently.

Before, we were able to import the full site without attachments and only copy the attachments afterwards. This was the only approach that work for sites with very large attachments, as the import would fail, generally due to out of memory problems.

Now, the IDs of attachments are modified during the import, which causes the attachments not to be found when copying them to the right place.

This is simply preventing full site migration in Cloud, as no other option is left.
fields.summary: New handling of attachments is preventing separate attachment migration

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In JIRA 7, when the Confluence Page gadget is added to the dashboard, the CSS style is not applied to the page. Instead, only basic HTML is displayed. This works fine for previous versions of JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In your JIRA dashboard, add the Confluence Page Gadget as per [the documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Add+a+Confluence+Gadget+to+a+JIRA+Dashboard].
# In the settings, link it to any of your pages in Confluence and click *Save*.
# The page will be displayed as basic HTML.

h3. Expected Results
The pages would be displayed with the same style they have in Confluence

h3. Actual Results
The pages are displayed with no style, only basic HTML.

h3. Notes
This happens for JIRA version 7.0.0-OD-01-193 and Confluence version 5.9.1-OD-65-062.

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Confluence Page Gadget is not applying CSS style

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Recently, this bug was fixed:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28582

This is a problem where Confluence would remove empty lines when copying/pasting code in the Code Macro.

However, the fix version is still causing some empty lines to be removed after saving.

This case specifically, when we add 'n' lines in a row to copied/pasted text, only 'n-1' are preserved, one is deleted.

h3. Environment
Tested in Mac OS.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a text editor and write:
{noformat}
Line 1
Line 2
{noformat}
# Copy it and paste in a code macro in a Confluence page
# Remove all empty lines added (because for some reason many are added)
# Save it (no empty lines exist)
# Edit the page again
# Add an empty line between Line 1 and Line 2
# Save it

h3. Expected Results
The empty line is preserved.

h3. Actual Results
The empty line disappears.
 
h3. Notes
If you add several lines in a row, all but one is preserved.

h3.Workaround
If you want 'n' empty lines, add 'n+1'.
fields.summary: Code macro does not maintain all empty lines when copy and pasted

* Open a page on https://pub.jira-dev.com/wiki
* Click 'Edit'
* Press command F, type a search string
* Press Enter
The page will save instead of performing a page find.

This is happening on pug but not extranet.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attempting to download an attachment from a page using the file attachment macro, the attachment fails to download

h3. Environment
Cloud 1000.230.0

h3. Expected Results
Attachment should download

h3. Actual Results
Attachment does not download
Confluence displays a 'Page cannot be found' page

An error like the following can be seen in the Developer console of the web browser:

{noformat}
/wiki/download/attachments/65146700/20070711_filename?api=v2
{noformat}

h3. Notes
The files appear to be in the file system as they are represented as a '1' which is present
When attempting to preview one of these attachments, the preview is displayed without any error

h3.Workaround
If the issue is with a Word doc, it appears that you can expand the attachment information panel
Click the 'Edit in Office' button
Save a new version of the attachment
fields.summary: Some attachments fail to download when using the file attachment macro

fields.description:
Today, the learn notification (red dot on help) presented the following topic: "Customizing your dashboard". Clicking on the ["Show me how|https://ace.atlassian.com/del/ck.php?oaparams=2__bannerid=1220__zoneid=83__oadest=https%3A%2F%2Fconfluence.atlassian.com%2Fdisplay%2FAOD%2FCustomising%2Byour%2BPersonal%2BDashboard%2F%3Fatl_medium%3Dace%26atl_camp%3Dace-714-feature-usage-customize-your-dashboard%26atl_camptype%3Dres%26atl_source%3Dstpc"] button leads to a "page not found" page which lists alternatives. If I select the "Customising your Personal Dashboard (Atlassian OnDemand Documentation)" it navigates to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Customising+your+Personal+Dashboard which redirect me instantly back to where I came from: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Customising+your+Personal+Dashboard.

Therefore, there is no way to consult the Cloud version of "Customizing your dashboard".

(!) Affected version not listed: 5.7-OD-48-071
fields.summary: "Customising your Personal Dashboard" documentation not available on Cloud

fields.description:
Steps leading to this bug:
# Entity is changed which schedules a flush in three seconds.
# Second entity is changed half a second before the flush starts and thus no new flush is scheduled.
# When the flush runs, it will only see entries that were added a second or more ago due to how {{JournalManager}} works.

Outcome:
Second entity will not be indexed before a third entity is changed.
fields.summary: Some changes might not appear in search results before new changes are made

fields.description:
When users view a page that has Gallery Macro for small amount of attachments those have many versions, Confluence runs very slow and  OOME may happen.

Early investigation shows that Confluence will try to load all versions of the attachments to memory in order to filter out for the latest versions which is very memory consuming and slow.

The same problem was there for Page Banner Plugin in showing number of attachments in the page but has been quickly fixed by Steve Lancashire
fields.summary: Confluence is very slow and OOME happen to view Gallery Macro that display attachments which have many versions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Confluence Cloud Space Admin are able to grant access to the two groups (confluence-administrator and system-administrator). These groups are reserved for [Atlassian Cloud Support|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-groups-744721627.html]. This can cause confusion as traditionally the highest form of admins in Cloud (site-admins) cannot see the two group under user management. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Hide the two support groups to Space Admins. Only show to site-admin and sysadmins. 
 
h3. Workaround 

No current workaround. The end user must be aware of the two groups and their function.
fields.summary: Remove/Hide Confluence-Administrator and System-Administrator from Confluence Cloud Space Admins

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the roadmap planner on a page on Confluence the user is not able to change the colours of the roadmap planners boards.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add Roadmap planner macro to a page
# Edit the page
# Edit the macro Roadmap Planner
# Click on the left side on the board where says "Lane1" or "Lane2"
# Try to change the colour

h3. Expected Results
More colours should appear to change the colour of the board

h3. Actual Results
The dropdown menu with the colours does not appear
 
h3. Notes
This was reproduce on Cloud instances with confluence version 1000.32.0
You can take a look on my test instance to reproduce the issue: https://pece.atlassian.net/wiki/display/CR/Code%3A+Veronica

h3.Workaround
None so far.

fields.description:
Please see attached recording. This was recorded in a space with collaborative editing but I've checked and the issue is reproducible without collaborative editing as well.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Insert a table, add some text to the table so you can observe formatting changes
2. After that table, insert an expand macro
3. Nest another table inside the expand macro, add some text to the table so you can observe formatting changes
4. Place your cursor to the right of the first table
5. Use Cmd + 1 to apply H1 styling at your cursor - notice this changes the styling of the entire macro below
fields.summary: Placing the cursor at the end of the table can apply formatting changes to the wrong place

 !Screen Shot 2016-06-03 at 11.27.57 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
!Screen Shot 2016-06-03 at 11.22.24 AM.png|thumbnail!

There is no workaround available at the moment

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a new production Confluence instance
 # Enable Atlassian account login
 # Make sure you have a profile photo set with your Atlassian account
 # Log in with your Atlassian account
 # Notice you have a blue man instead of your photo
 # Go to change your photo
 # You'll go to Atlassian account with the "drag a new image" dialog open, but behind that you can see your existing Atlassian account photo.

Reason I found this – we just spun up a new production Confluence Cloud instance for Product Fabric using HAL (product-fabric.atlassian.net) and I signed in with my prod Atlassian account which has a profile photo, but it didn't come through for me or anyone else in the team.

Also worth mentioning that JIRA works as expected and uses my Atlassian account photo.
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud does not show Atlassian account profile photo when one is set

Full stacktrace available here:
[^thread_stacktrace.txt]

We could also see that a single page is the problem. In a case, we believe this was cause by a failed operation to save a draft.

The content necessary to cause the issue is not absolutely clear, but we:
# Copied the 'body' from bodycontent from an affected page
# Injected into the 'body' of an existing page in a test instance (same version)
# Apart from that page, the instance was empty
# We replicated it in every case. An outage was caused, CPU had a spike at around 200% and an outage occurred very quickly, though nothing else was used
# Same thread strack trace
# For this test, only the 'body' of the page was copied, so no other meta data connected to the page was necessary to cause it.

h3. Environment
Affected version: 1000.130.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access an affected page with section macro (section macro alone is not enough, but it's not yet absolutely clear what in the page causes it)

h3. Expected Results
Page loads successfully.

h3. Actual Results
An outage is caused with threads taking up all resources.
 
h3.Workaround
# Disable the 'Layout Macros' add-on to prevent this error
# Once the page in identified, removing it or only its version should resolve the issue.
fields.summary: Section macro is causing outages in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence page previews are showing HTML content due to Content Formatting Macro from Adaptavist not loading some modules.
The align (xhtml-align) and center (xhtml-center) modules are disabled and causing issues in Confluence page displaying.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 1000.161.0
* Adaptavist Content Formatting Macros Version:2.0.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a page that has a centering formatted text, e.g.

h3. Expected Results
- Text should show up centered.

h3. Actual Results
- HTML tags are showing up instead.
 
h3. Notes
This seems to reset every day when a new install-studio is triggered.
If this occurs, disable and re-enable the 'align (xhtml-align)' and 'center (xhtml-center)' modules

h3.Workaround
h5. Contact Atlassian Support to get the add-ons module enabled:
For support: {quote}
# Go to manage add-ons and enable the modules:
#* align (xhtml-align);
#* center (xhtml-center);
{quote}
fields.summary: Content Formatting Macro from Adaptavist not loading some modules

fields.description:
For months I had the same set of "Created vs Resolved" charts, with the cumulative option being enabled, embedded in one of our confluence pages on our Atlassian OnDemand instance.

But for a couple of days now (or 1-2 weeks maybe, unsure) the charts are not showing the cumulative results anymore. However, I cannot actually click the "Edit" button in the chart's edit dialog (in the preview pane). Nothing happens.
If I copy the link of the edit button and open in a new window, I just get the same chart.

Next step I tried was to create a new "Created vs. Resolved" chart, but that only lead to an empty preview pane with a warning to fill in the details in the preview pain (sic!).
I have attached a screenshot of what that dialog looks like.

This seems to be a regression (unless it's an issue with our specific instance). Our exact version is {{6.0.0-OD-2015.48.1-0006}}.
fields.summary: "Created vs Resolved" Chart broken in Confluence (existing one not cumulative, can't create new one)

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

LuceneIndexFlusher Causes Chain OOME (Out of Memory Error) when trying to Render Huge Objects. When the scheduler kicks in, and there are a large file/content to be rendered into index, it causes Chain OOME until the file is removed. 

h2. Expected Result

This should be tracked even in the event of catastrophic failure (such as OOME taking down the application), and thus the attempt should be recorded and committed before the attempt, not after.

And it should record it on the logs that this is skipped due to the same reasoning.

h2. Actual Result

The instance will run into OOME every time the schedule call for the method, and ultimately causing repeated down time on an instance.

h2. Workaround

To remove the affected huge object (attachments or content) to avoid the instance from running into OOME.
fields.summary: LuceneIndexFlusher Causes Chain OOME when trying to Render Huge Objects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to drag & drop an additional file to an already saved page in Confluence, the upload fails and displays to uploads of the file

h3. Environment
Cloud Confluence 1000.150.0


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new page
# Drag & drop a file on the page
# Save the page
# Edit the page
# Drag & drop another file onto the page


h3. Expected Results
The file should be uploaded


h3. Actual Results
The file does not upload. Instead two uploads of the new file are seen that do not progress.

!doubleupload.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Notes
There is no error in the Confluence log
The developer console in the browser shows the following error

{{Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'encoding' of undefined  that shows up in the dev}}

h3.Workaround
Clicking the image button or attachment button and selecting an image or file will result in a successful upload

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Up until Confluence version 1000.150.0 exporting a page to PDF by clicking the 3 dots menu and selecting "_Export to PDF_" option would create the PDF and present the option to download it within the same page (without refreshing the page or loading another page).
However, from Confluence version 1000.161.0 forward the export page to PDF is considered to be a long running task, thus when a page export to PDF is selected it loads the "long running tasks" page before presenting the download link.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a page click the 3 dots menu
# Select the "_Export to PDF_" option

h3. Expected Results
A direct download of the PDF.
!1000.150.0.mp4!

h3. Actual Results
The long running tasks page is loaded and only then the export is processed and it produces a link instead of the direct download file.
!1000.161.0.mp4!

h3. Notes
This breaks Bob Swift's CLI, specifically the example 123 on [this examples pages|https://bobswift.atlassian.net/wiki/display/CSOAP/Examples].
Also, if you used cURL to automate PDF exports download this no longer works as cURL returns the HTML of the long running tasks page.

h3.Workaround
Click the Download here link in the Long Running Tasks screen.

Or if you use automation you can make use of the [longtask method|https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/REST/latest/#longtask] of Confluence's REST API to get the link to download the file.
fields.summary: Cannot curl the page pdf action endpoint to directly download the pdf

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Following a link from one page to an anchor on another page in Firefox will only bring you to the top of the linked page, and not directly to the anchor.

h3. Environment
* Firefox 39.0
* Confluence 5.9.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence with anchor links on a few items.
# On a separate page, create a direct link to the anchor link. (i.e. https://CONFLUENCE_URL/display/SPACEKEY/PAGE_NAME#ANCHOR_LINK)
# Attempt to follow the anchor link in Firefox, either from the 2nd page, or directly via the address bar. 

h3. Expected Results
In Chrome and other browsers, clicking the link will take you directly to the anchor.

h3. Actual Results
# Link will take you to the top of the linked page, but not directly to the anchor.
# Additionally, you can try following the link directly from your address bar. You'll have the same behavior.
 
h3.Workaround
Use another browser, such as Chrome.
fields.summary: Unable to follow anchor link to another page in Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new blank space.
# Confirm that the space permissions allow restrictions to be set.
# Load the new space's homepage, go into the "..." menu and choose Attachments.
# On the Attachments page, choose "..." > Page Restrictions.

h3. Expected results
The restrictions dialog loads and you can set restrictions.

h3. Actual results
The restrictions dialog says "You're not allowed to change these restrictions. It's either due to edit restrictions on the page, or permissions settings for this space".

h3. Workaround
Set restrictions from the page itself, not its list of attachments.

h3. Notes
Confluence hits {{/pages/getcontentpermissions.action?contentId=<content id>&parentPageId=<parent content id>&spaceKey=<key>}} when viewing the restrictions from the main page itself, but when you view it from the Attachments page the content ID isn't passed and it hits {{/pages/getcontentpermissions.action?parentPageId=<parent content id>&spaceKey=<key>}} and gets an error back:

{code}
{
    "errorMessage": "No content found for the given content ID"
}
{code}
fields.summary: Page Restrictions dialog won't load restrictions when accessed from Attachments page

The body of the request is (as per the rest documentation here https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/REST/latest/#content-createContent): {"type": "page", "title": "Test Page data", "space":{"key":"PM"}, "body":{"storage":{"value":"

This is a new page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When navigating to Space Administration > Restricted Pages, a Space Admin should be able to remove page restrictions for a page they are restricted from viewing by selecting the unlock icon next to a user. However, when an unlocked icon is clicked, the space admin is redirected to the restricted page and has to navigate back to the restricted pages menu. The restriction is removed but this adds confusion, and the user must still navigate back to remove each restriction.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to Space Administration > Restricted Pages
# Select an unlock icon next to a user's view or edit restrictions
# Space Admin will be redirected to restricted page that they do not have access to.
# Lock is removed, navigate back to menu and select another unlock icon. Same thing occurs.

h3. Expected Results
Restriction should be removed but user should remain on Restricted Pages menu to continue to removing restrictions as needed.

h3. Actual Results
User is taken to restricted page.
 
h3. Notes
This does not happen for sysadmin or System Administrator, only happens to Space Admins.

h3.Workaround
Navigate back to Restricted Pages each time, which can be very tedious for pages with a lot of restrictions.
fields.summary: Removing Page Restrictions Redirects to the Page

fields.description:
I am using anchors in my pages. I have a problem that appears to only occur in the DEFAULT theme.

The problem arises when I use anchors in a table. I can set up the anchor and create a link to it. When I save the page and click the link, the page displays at the anchor point, however, the exact location is hidden beneath the table header as the header always displays. Not ideal.

Steps to produce:
Create a page with a large table—it needs to be large enough to scroll off the page.
Add an anchor about 10 rows down.
Add a link to that anchor near the bottom of the table.
Save the page.
Scroll to and click the link.
The page SHOULD go back up to the anchor (I have another problem in which the page keeps 'losing' anchor links but this is a separate issue). The anchor text is hidden by the permanently displayed table header.
fields.summary: Anchors broken in default theme...
Unable to Create from Modified Blueprint After Migration into Cloud

fields.description:
When a calendar is embedded on a page using the Team Calendars macro and the macro is within a section (there needs to be 2 or more sections in the page) the options for that calendar are cut off on Chrome.

Steps to reproduce:
- Create a page and add 2 sections in it
- Add the Team Calendars macro in the second section and select a calendar to be displayed
- Edit the macro and make sure the Calendar legend is set to bottom
- Save the page
- Click the three dots on the right side of the calendars name at the bottom of the calendar
fields.summary: Calendar's options are cut off when using Chrome

# Scroll up to the first mention of {{object class="SpacePermission" package="com.atlassian.confluence.security"}} above {{REMOVEOWNCONTENT}}

# Save the entities.xml file and add it back to your space zip.

h3. ***Summary***
Umlaute in Attachments Breaks Attachment Link in Safari.

h3. ***Steps to Reproduce***
# Add attachments with umlaute to a page
# Edit page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Attachments uploaded between the date range Friday March 4th (03/04/2016) to Monday March 7th (03/07/2016) may have run into a Document conversion error where the uploaded attachments fail to render the Preview once uploaded, displaying the error:
{noformat}
We can't preview this file.
You'll have to download the file to view it.
{noformat}

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload Attachment to Confluence
# attempt to preview the attachment

h3. Expected Results
Attachment Loads in preview mode

h3. Actual Results
Error Popup:
{noformat}
We can't preview this file.
You'll have to download the file to view it.
{noformat}
!Screen Shot 2016-03-07 at 4.23.43 PM.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
This Bug has already been Fixed moving forward on production, please see the workaround for instructions on repairing erring attachments uploaded during the noted window.

h3.Workaround
Additional details can be found in:
- [Manage Files: Confluence Cloud Documentation | https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/manage-files-724765113.html] You will need to:
-- Manually download the attachment
-- Delete the original erring attachment from Confluence
-- Re-upload the attachment
fields.summary: Image preview fails due to document conversion error in confluence cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When viewing the inherited view restrictions on a page in confluence, the Restrictions are displayed from the topmost page down.  Only 9 values will display in the dropdown, and any more are cut off and not visible
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/page-restrictions-724764891.html

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.14.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Grand parrent page
# Add 9 or more restrictions
# Create a child page of the Grand parent page (Parrent page)
# Add any number of Restrictions to the parent page
# Create a child page of the Parent page
# View *inherited view restrictions*

h3. Expected Results
Ability to see all restrictions in the avaliable space, or have the ability to scroll to see the restrictions below the visible window

h3. Actual Results
Anything past 9 is cut off and not visible
 
h3. Notes
More than 9 restrictions applied to Grand parent:
!Screen Shot 2016-04-12 at 10.06.55 AM.png|thumbnail!

Less than 9 Applied to Grandparent:
!Screen Shot 2016-04-12 at 10.05.18 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
To see the restrictions you must manually navigate to the parent page
fields.summary: inherited view restrictions cut off and cannot view all inherited permissions

fields.description:
As part of Jira Acceptance Test a user is created using the JIRA REST API, which is then synchronized with the Crowd, and then (through Crowd) with Confluence. Confluence synchronizes with Crowd successfully (synchronization is logged by Confluence, and the user exists in the Confluence DB). However it is impossible to log in with the user. To log in, one can:
 - restart the Confluence instance
 - drop the user and create him again
 - reset the Confluence cache through the Confluence REST API

This error happens non-deterministically, about once in 80 runs.

Attached is the Confluence stacktrace, and a screenshot of the login page message.
fields.summary: Confluence cache update fails after Crowd sync

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user has {{view}} permissions on a space (regardless of edit or create page permissions), and the sidebar is set to display *Page Tree*, and there are no pages to be displayed in the page tree, they will see the following dialogue instead:

{noformat}Get started by adding some pages to this space. Create page.{noformat}.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.14.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable Anonymous *Can Use* permissions in Confluence Global Permissions.
# Create a new space. Delete all pages that can be viewed under *Page Tree*
# Edit space permissions, allow Anonymous user to *View* the space.
# Ensure *Page Tree* is selected under *Navigation display options*  when modifying the sidebar
# Open the instance in a new tab in Incognito mode to ensure you're not logged in.

h3. Expected Results
Since your anonymous user does not have create page permissions, they should not see the prompt to create a new page.

h3. Actual Results
The following is seen by a user without permission to create a page:
 !Screen Shot 2016-04-13 at 12.37.17.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No workaround as long as you are showing the Page Tree in the sidebar.
fields.summary: User without create page permissions able to see create page prompt in sidebar

fields.description:
When you upload a file using webdav (rather than through the editor), the file initially appears in the attachment list, but disappears after you try to insert it in the editor. 

Steps to reproduce:

1. Connect to your cloud site using webdav (I used Finder) instructions here https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+WebDAV+client+for+Confluence#ConfiguringaWebDAVclientforConfluence-UsingaWebDAVClienttoWorkwithPages
2. Drill down to a page
3. Drop a file into the page directory  
4. In your Cloud site, navigate to the page and view the list of attachments - the file appears. 
5. In the editor insert the file. 

When you save, a storage format error is thrown, and the file is no longer visible in the attachments view, or in the webdav folder.
fields.summary: Can't insert files uploaded via WebDav in Cloud
The Livesearch macro does not respond in the expected way when put in the sidebar of a Space

fields.summary: Chrome displays Gliffy diagram metadata instead of downloading it when its name is clicked

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After instance Restart from the Critical Patch that was pushed out to fix Bug:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-38541

HTML and CSS page block macros In confluence do not render correctly

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# All Existing or new HTML blocks fail to render properly
# Edit page and View Preview shows correctly rendered Layout

h3. Expected Results
The Html renders as it did in preview

h3. Actual Results
When using tables to edit a Confluence page the preview shows one way the page renders in another. Plugin Adaptavist Content Formatting Macros enable.
See attachment.

h3. Cause
This was inadvertently caused by some recent macro wrapping changes. It can be disabled by Atlassian Support.

h3.Workarounds
* For HTML Tables, the best workaround is to use the [inbuilt table functionality|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Working+with+Tables] in Confluence.
* An alternative is to disable the Macro Wrapping feature. You will need to contact Atlassian Support to have them disable it. NB: It may cause some loss of functionality in Inline Comments and Quick Edit.
* There is currently no workaround for CSS Stylesheet problems, but it is resolved in an upcoming release and we will keep you up to date with when that will be deployed.
fields.summary: HTML table not rendering properly.

fields.summary: Unable to create a backup in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:

*Workaround:*
# Check on Confluence database if this group exists in there. E.g.:
{code:sql}select * from cwd_group where id = 3702785;{code}
This will display the group name.
# Now, check if the same is on crowd database (same SQL above). 
## If it does not exist on crowd, just visit the instance > go to User Management > Groups > Add and then remove the same group.
## Just ran a UD Sync and the problem will be fixed.

(!) For Cloud users, please raise a ticket on [Atlassian Support|http://support.atlassian.com] so we can check all that.

*Notes:*
This seems that for some reason, Confluence database is not updated with crowd. Usually this missing groups are related to JSD (even when customer does not have it enabled).
fields.summary: UD Syncronization fails due to missing group on Confluence Database. Therefore, new Confluence users cannot login.
